info.name: List of 10 public free APIs for students

item.name: 1. The Data USA API

request.description:
This API request gets population data at the national level in recent years.

Link: [https://datausa.io/about/api/](https://datausa.io/about/api/)

response.name: Recent Population data
response.body:
{
    "data": [
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2020,
            "Year": "2020",
            "Population": 326569308,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        },
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2019,
            "Year": "2019",
            "Population": 324697795,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        },
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2018,
            "Year": "2018",
            "Population": 322903030,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        },
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2017,
            "Year": "2017",
            "Population": 321004407,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        },
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2016,
            "Year": "2016",
            "Population": 318558162,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        },
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2015,
            "Year": "2015",
            "Population": 316515021,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        },
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2014,
            "Year": "2014",
            "Population": 314107084,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        },
        {
            "ID Nation": "01000US",
            "Nation": "United States",
            "ID Year": 2013,
            "Year": "2013",
            "Population": 311536594,
            "Slug Nation": "united-states"
        }
    ],
    "source": [
        {
            "measures": [
                "Population"
            ],
            "annotations": {
                "source_name": "Census Bureau",
                "source_description": "The American Community Survey (ACS) is conducted by the US Census and sent to a portion of the population every year.",
                "dataset_name": "ACS 5-year Estimate",
                "dataset_link": "http://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/",
                "table_id": "B01003",
                "topic": "Diversity",
                "subtopic": "Demographics"
            },
            "name": "acs_yg_total_population_5",
            "substitutions": []
        }
    ]
}

item.description:
With this API you can access US Gov data on various industries and departments

Link: [https://datausa.io/about/api/](https://datausa.io/about/api/to)

item.name: 2. Teleport Public APIs
List of cities that match name "Tokyo"

request.description:
This request searches for cities by name and returns a list of all matching cities

Link: [https://developers.teleport.org/api/reference/#/](https://developers.teleport.org/api/reference/#/)

response.name: List of cities that match name "Tokyo"

item.description:
With this API you can get data on various cities such as quality of Life data (Education level, Environmental Quality, Internet Connectivity etc.)

Link: [https://developers.teleport.org/api/reference/#/](https://developers.teleport.org/api/reference/#/)

item.name: 3. Open Brewery API

request.description:
This request returns a list of breweries.

Link: [https://www.openbrewerydb.org/documentation](https://www.openbrewerydb.org/documentation)

response.name: List of breweries

item.description:
Open Brewery DB is a free dataset and API with public information on breweries, cideries, brewpubs, and bottleshops.

Link: [https://www.openbrewerydb.org/](https://www.openbrewerydb.org/)

item.name: 4. NYC Parks & Rec Properties API

url.raw: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/resource/enfh-gkve.json?location=100 St., 98 St. bet. 24 Ave. and 25 Ave.

query.value: 100 St., 98 St. bet. 24 Ave. and 25 Ave.

request.description:
This request gets a description of the location of a property with respect to the street system and physical features such as water bodies.

Link: [https://dev.socrata.com/foundry/data.cityofnewyork.us/enfh-gkve](https://dev.socrata.com/foundry/data.cityofnewyork.us/enfh-gkve)

response.name: location of property

                            -73.87111215081137,
                            40.76543199193358
                        ],
                        [
                            -73.87100128360814,

                    ]
                ]
            ]
        }

]

item.description:
This API provides access to property data managed partially or solely by NYC Parks.

[https://dev.socrata.com/foundry/data.cityofnewyork.us/enfh-gkve](https://dev.socrata.com/foundry/data.cityofnewyork.us/enfh-gkve)

item.name: 5. Sunset and Sunrise Times API

request.description:
This request gets the current day's sunrise and sunset times  
  
  
Link: [https://sunrisesunset.io/api/](https://sunrisesunset.io/api/)

response.name: Sunrise & Sunset times
response.body:
{
    "results": {
        "sunrise": "9:52:03 AM",
        "sunset": "12:20:22 AM",
        "first_light": "8:01:33 AM",
        "last_light": "2:10:52 AM",
        "dawn": "9:21:29 AM",
        "dusk": "12:50:56 AM",
        "solar_noon": "5:06:12 PM",
        "golden_hour": "11:41:50 PM",
        "day_length": "14:28:19",
        "timezone": "UTC"
    },
    "status": "OK"
}

item.description:
SunriseSunset.io offers a **free API** for retrieving sunrise and sunset times for a specific longitude and latitude.

Link: [https://sunrisesunset.io/api/](https://sunrisesunset.io/api/)

item.name: 6. MusicBrainz API

request.description:
This request returns data for the rock band Nirvana

Link: [https://musicbrainz.org/doc/MusicBrainz_API/Examples](https://musicbrainz.org/doc/MusicBrainz_API/Examples)

response.name: Data on rock band Nirvana
response.body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<metadata xmlns="http://musicbrainz.org/ns/mmd-2.0#">
    <artist id="5b11f4ce-a62d-471e-81fc-a69a8278c7da" type="Group" type-id="e431f5f6-b5d2-343d-8b36-72607fffb74b">
        <name>Nirvana</name>
        <sort-name>Nirvana</sort-name>
        <disambiguation>90s US grunge band</disambiguation>
        <isni-list>
            <isni>0000000123486830</isni>
            <isni>0000000123487390</isni>
        </isni-list>
        <country>US</country>
        <area id="489ce91b-6658-3307-9877-795b68554c98">
            <name>United States</name>
            <sort-name>United States</sort-name>
            <iso-3166-1-code-list>
                <iso-3166-1-code>US</iso-3166-1-code>
            </iso-3166-1-code-list>
        </area>
        <begin-area id="a640b45c-c173-49b1-8030-973603e895b5">
            <name>Aberdeen</name>
            <sort-name>Aberdeen</sort-name>
        </begin-area>
        <life-span>
            <begin>1988-01</begin>
            <end>1994-04-05</end>
            <ended>true</ended>
        </life-span>
        <alias-list count="3">
            <alias locale="en" sort-name="Nirvana" type="Artist name" type-id="894afba6-2816-3c24-8072-eadb66bd04bc" primary="primary">Nirvana</alias>
            <alias sort-name="Nirvana US">Nirvana US</alias>
            <alias locale="ja" sort-name="ニルヴァーナ" type="Artist name" type-id="894afba6-2816-3c24-8072-eadb66bd04bc" primary="primary">ニルヴァーナ</alias>
        </alias-list>
    </artist>
</metadata>

item.description:
With this API you can look up information about a particular MusicBrainz artist/group  
("give me info about The Beatles"), browse the data to find entities connected to a particular entity ("show me all releases by The Beatles"), or search for entities matching a specific query ("show me  
all artists matching the query 'Beatles' so I can find the one I want and ask for more data").

Link: [https://musicbrainz.org/doc/MusicBrainz_API](https://musicbrainz.org/doc/MusicBrainz_API)

item.name: 7. Universities API

request.description:
This request gets a university name and domain given a search term and country

Link: [https://github.com/Hipo/university-domains-list](https://github.com/Hipo/university-domains-list)

item.description:
With this API you can get access data on a list of universities and their domain names

Example usecases:

- You can create a validation script that checks the email domain.
- You can automatically generate a user's country and university by looking at their emails.
    

[https://github.com/Hipo/university-domains-list](https://github.com/Hipo/university-domains-list)

item.name: 8. OpenFDA API

request.description:
This request searches in the `drug/event`endpoint for a single record, and returns it. The record contains all kinds of information about the adverse event report, including the drugs that the patient was taking, the reactions that the patient experienced, and a good deal of other context.

Each endpoint has its own unique fields, particular to the kind of data that it serves.

Link: [https://open.fda.gov/apis/try-the-api/](https://open.fda.gov/apis/try-the-api/)

response.name: Drug record

item.description:
openFDA is an [Elasticsearch-based](http://www.elasticsearch.org/) API that serves public [FDA](http://www.fda.gov/) data about nouns like [drugs](https://open.fda.gov/apis/drug/), [devices](https://open.fda.gov/apis/device/), and [foods](https://open.fda.gov/apis/food/).

Link: [https://open.fda.gov/apis/](https://open.fda.gov/apis/)

item.name: 9. Free Weather API

request.description:
This request gets the current weather and future weather forecasts

Link: [https://open-meteo.com/](https://open-meteo.com/)

item.description:
Open-Meteo is an open-source weather API with free access for non-commercial use. No API key is required. You can use it immediately!

Link: [https://open-meteo.com/](https://open-meteo.com/)

item.name: 10. The Met Collection API

request.description:
This request returns a listing of all Object IDs for objects that contain the search query within the object’s data

Link: [https://metmuseum.github.io/#search](https://metmuseum.github.io/#search)

item.description:
With this API you can access data on more than 470,000 artworks in the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

Link: [https://metmuseum.github.io/](https://metmuseum.github.io/)
